meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get this review party started!

The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame has been getting some... let's say, "interesting" reviews. But hey, I'm here to give you the lowdown on what makes this game tick (or not).

First off, let me just say that I'm no LEGO expert. In fact, I'm more like a LEGO newb who's still learning the ropes of building and bashing things together. BUT, that doesn't mean I can't have some fun with this game! So, buckle up, kiddos, and join me on this wild ride!

So, what do the critics say? Well, COGconnected thinks it's a "frustrating cash grab" (ouch!). Eurogamer Italy says it looks like a LEGO World reskin without the humor or pace of the movie. Metro GameCentral calls it a "cheap and nasty film tie-in" that reaches new lows for LEGO games. Yikes!

But wait, there are some rays of sunshine in this review storm! 3DJuegos thinks the sandbox gameplay mechanics are interesting (yay!) and refresh the overused LEGO formula. Meristation says it's one of the easiest LEGO games out there, making it perfect for little ones.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about TheSixthAxis' review?" Well, let me just say that their opinion is... well, let's just say they're not exactly thrilled with this game. They call it an uninspired and dull reskin of LEGO Worlds that tosses all the good parts out the window.

So, what does it all mean? To be honest, I'm a bit torn myself. The gameplay seems fun (and easy!), but some of these critics' points do sting. Maybe this game is just meant for younglings who love LEGO and don't care about graphics or depth?

In any case, if you're looking for a fun romp with some familiar LEGO characters, this might be the game for you! Just don't expect too much in terms of complexity or challenge (but hey, that's what LEGO Worlds is for, right?).

All in all, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is an... interesting experience. If you're a fan of the franchise and want some light-hearted fun, this might be up your alley! Otherwise, you might just want to stick with LEGO World or one of the many other awesome LEGO games out there.

That's it for now, folks! See you in the next review!
